David es un ombre i Lea es una mujer

What do you want to eat?
I want to eat an apple.
Do you drink milk or water?
Yo komo pan i bevo agua
I eat bread and drink water

Do you eat bread and drink water? Yes, I eat bread and drink water.
El ombre beve agua. La mujer beve leche.
The man drinks water. The woman drinks milk.
They eat a lot of bread
Ke keres komer? Pan o mansana?
What do you want to eat? Bread or apple?
Yo kero komer {un poko} de pan.
I want to eat {a bit} of bread.
Ke keres bever? Leche o Agua?
What do you want to drink? Milk or water?
Tu moras en Yerushalayim? Si, yo moro en Yerushalayim
Do you live in Jerusalem? Yes, I live in Jerusalem
Tu moras en {Tel Aviv?} No, yo no moro en {Tel Aviv}
Do you live in {Tel Aviv?} No, I don't live in {Tel Aviv}
Tu tienes animales? Si, yo tengo un gato.
Do you have animals? Yes, I have a cat.
Tu tienes animales? No, yo no tengo animales.
Do you have animals? No I don't have animals.
Tu tienes animales? Si, yo tengo un gato.
Do you have animals? Yes, I have a cat.
Yo tengo un perro i dos gatos.
I have a dog and two cats.
Yo tengo un gato i dos perros.
I have a cat and two dogs.
Yo moro kon mi padre i kon mi madre
I live with my father and with my mother

David es mi tio. El es el ermano de mi madre.
David is my uncle. He is the brother of my mother.

Rina is my cousin. Her mother and my father are brothers.

Haim is my cousin. His mother and my mother are sisters.

# Avlar

*   avlar - to speak
*   yo avlo
*   tu avlas
*   el avla
*   eya avla
*   mozotros avlamos
*   vozotros avlash
*   eyos avlan

# Dever

dever - have to
yo                devo
tu                deves
el/eya            deve
mozotros/mozotras devemos
vozotros/vozotras devesh
eyos/eyas         deven
When do you want to start the class?
When do you start to cook?
How many languages do you understand?
David writes a letter in Spanish
Yo eskrivo bien en Kasteyano i en Fransez.
I write well in Spanish and French.

# Kantar

kantar - to sing
| to sing            | kantar    |
| ------------------ | --------- |
| yo                 | kanto     |
| tu                 | kantas    |
| el/eya             | kanta     |
| mozotros/mozotras  | kantamos  |
| vozotros/vozotras  | kantash   |
| eyos               | kantan    |
We want to talk to the teacher
Eyos keren konoser a mi famiya
They want to meet my family
{I like} to eat apple with cheese

# Komer

komer to eat
yo                komo    (I) eat
tu                komes   (you) eat
el/eya            kome    he/she eats
mozotros/mozotras komemos (we) eat
vozotros/vozotras komesh  (you) eat (plural)
eyos              komen   (they) eat

# kontar

kontar - to count, to tell
| yo                | konto    |
| tu                | konta    |
| el/eya            | konta    |
| mozotros/mozotras | kontamos |
| vozotros/vozotras | kontash  |
| eyos              | kontan   |
Tu meldas un livro en Ladino
You read a book in Ladino
I read a lot of books
Where {were you born?} I {was born} in Thessaloniki
What is the name of your mother?
What is the name of your father?

# call, being called

*   yamar: to call
*   yamarse: to be called oneself (reflexive)
*   me yamo
*   te yamas
*   se yama
*   mos yamamos
*   vos yamash
*   se yaman

# Pronouns

*   yo - I
*   tu - you
*   el - he
*   eya - she
*   mozotros - we (masc.)
*   mozotras - we (fem.)
*   vozotros - you (masc. plural)
*   vozotras - you (fem. plural)
*   eyos - they (masc.)
*   eyas - they (fem.)

# ser

In Ladino there are two words for "to be": ser and estar

*   yo so/se - I am
*   tu sos - you are
*   el es - he is
*   eya es - she is
*   mozotros somos/semos - we are
*   mozotras somos/semos - we are
*   vozotros sosh - you are (plural masc.)
*   vozotras sosh - you are (plural fem.)
*   eyos son - they are (masc.)
*   eyas son - they are (fem.)

# estar

In Ladino there are two words for "to be": ser and estar

*   yo esto
*   tu estas
*   el esta
*   eya esta
*   mozotros estamos
*   mozotras estamos
*   vozotros estash
*   vozotras estash
*   eyos estan
*   eyas estan

# Possesive Adjectives

## English Singular Plural

*   my mi mis
*   your tu tus
*   his / her su sus
*   our (male) muestro muestros
*   our (female) muestra muestras
*   your (plural male) vuestro vuestros
*   your (plural female) vuestra vuestras
*   their su sus
*   mi livro - my book
*   mis livros - my books
*   muestro livro - our book
*   muestros livros - our books

# City Names

*   city - [sivdad](https://lad.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sivdad)
*   [Istanbul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Istanbul) - [Estambol](https://lad.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estambol)
*   Kastoria - [Kastoria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kastoria)
*   [Saloniko](https://lad.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selanik) - [Thessaloniki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thessaloniki)
*   [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) - [Sivdad de Mueva York](https://lad.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sivdad_de_Mueva_York)
*   [Monastir](https://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/monastir)

Este grupo es para partajar kontenidos en djudeo-espanyol.
This group is to share content in Ladino.
No akseptamos publikasiones ke kontienen diskurso de aborresión o propaganda elektoral.
We don't accept publications that contain hate speech or election propaganda.
No akseptamos publikasiones de saludos jenerales komo "Buen día", "Shabat shalom" ets.
We don't accept publications general greetings such as "Good mornings", "Shabat shalom" etc.
Los kontenidos deven ser aviertos para todos
The contents must be open for everyone.
Semos un grupo públiko, dunke no akseptamos kontenidos non públikos.
We are a public group, therefore we don't accept non-public content.
